Package dnl.link

Class Link

  • java.lang.Object
    • dnl.link.Link
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Link>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CentroidConnector, CTM, LTM, MN, PointQueue
    public abstract class Link
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Link>
    This represents a link in the network. This is an abstract class: key methods are not implemented, and must be implemented in subclasses. These depend on the specific flow model.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs a new Link with the given parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Link

        public Link​(int id,
            Node source,
            Node dest,
            double length,
            double ffspd,
            double capacityPerLane,
            int numLanes)
        Constructs a new Link with the given parameters. Generally Links will be constructed in ReadNetwork. Jam density is global and found in Params Backwards wave speed may or may not be calculated based on these parameters - depends on the flow model.
        Parameters:
        id - id of this Link
        source - start Node of this Link
        dest - end Node of this Link
        length - length in mi
        ffspd - free flow speed in mi/hr
        capacityPerLane - capacity (per lane) in veh/hr
        numLanes - number of lanes

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets this Link to start a new dynamic network loading

      • getFFSpeed

        public double getFFSpeed()
        Returns:
        the free flow speed in mi/hr

      • getFFTime

        public double getFFTime()
        Returns:
        the free flow travel time in s.

      • getAvgTT

        public double getAvgTT()
        Returns:
        the travel time when entering at the given time (in s).

      • getTotalVolume

        public double getTotalVolume()
        Returns:
        the total flow recorded entering the link in the past simulation (# vehicles).

      • getTotalTT

        public double getTotalTT()
        Returns:
        the total time spent traveling on this link (in s)

      • getAvgGrade

        public double getAvgGrade()
        Returns:
        the average grade (change in elevation) in percent vertical change in ft per horizontal distance

      • getLength

        public double getLength()
        Returns:
        the length in mi

      • getCapacityPerLane

        public double getCapacityPerLane()
        Returns:
        the capacity per lane in veh/hr

      • getCapacity

        public double getCapacity()
        Returns:
        the total capacity in veh/hr

      • getNumLanes

        public double getNumLanes()
        Returns:
        the number of lanes

      • getSource

        public Node getSource()
        Returns:
        the upstream Node for this Link

      • getDest

        public Node getDest()
        Returns:
        the downstream Node for this Link

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Returns:
        the id for this Link

      • getOccupancy

        public abstract double getOccupancy()
        Returns:
        the number of vehicles currently on this Link.

      • step

        public abstract void step()
        This is called every time step. For the Link class, step() should propagate flow along the link.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        This is called every time step, after step() has been called for all Nodes and Links. It can be used to finish any updating work that could not occur during step().

      • addFlow

        public abstract void addFlow​(double y)
        Adds the given flow (in veh, for a single time step) to the upstream end of the link. This method is called when vehicles enter the link! This is usually called by the Node.step() method. Subclasses of link need to call logEnteringFlow(double) to update the average travel times.

      • logEnteringFlow

        public void logEnteringFlow​(double y)
        This is used to track the total number of vehicles entering this link. The number of vehicles is used to calculate the average travel time. This method is usually called by addFlow(double). Subclasses of Link should call this method as part of the addFlow(double) method.

      • logOccupancyTime

        public void logOccupancyTime()
        This method is used to calculate the average travel time. It should be called once per time step by the Network class.

      • calculateTravelTime

        public void calculateTravelTime()
        This method is used to calculate the total travel time at the end of the dynamic network loading. The result can be accessed by getAvgTT(). This method is called in Network.simulate().

      • removeFlow

        public abstract void removeFlow​(double y)
        Removes the given flow (in veh, for a single time step) from the downstream end of the link. This method is called when vehicles exit the link! This is usually called by the Node.step() method.
        Parameters:
        y - the flow to be removed

      • getSendingFlow

        public abstract double getSendingFlow()
        Returns:
        the maximum flow that could exit the link in the next time step (in veh)

      • getReceivingFlow

        public abstract double getReceivingFlow()
        Returns:
        the maximum flow that could enter the link in the next time step (in veh)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Link rhs)
        Used to sort Link by id.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Link>

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Used for hashing. You can ignore it.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the id of this Link
